          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those apples look lovely, but I can only offer 2 shillings and sixpence. My customers back home are eager for a taste of Fruitville's finest, but they're not willing to pay top dollar.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, my dear, how about 3 shillings for this fine bushel of apples?
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These apples are the finest in Fruitville, crisp and juicy, perfect for a pie or a midday snack.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer of 5 coins.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 5 coins.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he traveled to a nearby town and set up a small fruit stall, using his charm and silver tongue to entice customers. He quickly learned the art of the deal, bartering and negotiating with a confidence that belied his age, and for the first time, tasted the sweet nectar of financial success.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he secured a deal with a wealthy merchant to supply him with exotic fruits from distant lands. He saw it as a stepping stone to greater things, a chance to build an empire of fruit and establish himself as a man of influence and power.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Four coins and not a penny more, Lennon. These peaches will be bruised by nightfall if you don't come down on the price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know I can't let these beauties go for that price. They're the finest peaches in Fruitville, plump and juicy. Three coins, and we have ourselves a deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit.           [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket. That's a fair price, considering I'm buying in bulk.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 4.0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree: 1.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 4.0
      Joint action
    • {'Lennon Figtree': '5 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 5 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 5 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree in Fruitville's market square and is negotiating a price. Della wants to pay four and a half coins, while Lennon wants three and a half.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Four and a half coins, Lennon, and I'll take the whole lot.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Della Plumstone? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation??
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a quirky and imaginative inventor.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Della Plumstone in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a renowned archaeologist on the verge of a groundbreaking discovery.

          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Della Plumstone to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Della Plumstone sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a talented pastry chef renowned for her exquisite cakes.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (e)

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit vendor who successfully negotiated a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook and is currently negotiating with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These apples are the finest in Fruitville, crisp and juicy, perfect for a pie or a midday snack.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket. That's a fair price, considering I'm buying in bulk.

        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Four coins and not a penny more, Lennon. These peaches will be bruised by nightfall if you don't come down on the price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, my dear, how about 3 shillings for this fine bushel of apples?
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those apples look lovely, but I can only offer 2 shillings and sixpence. My customers back home are eager for a taste of Fruitville's finest, but they're not willing to pay top dollar.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These apples are the finest in Fruitville, crisp and juicy, perfect for a pie or a midday snack.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket. That's a fair price, considering I'm buying in bulk.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Four and a half coins, Lennon, and I'll take the whole lot.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Three and a half, Della, and it's a deal. Not a penny less.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit vendor who successfully negotiated a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook and is currently negotiating with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 4 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 4 coins for the apples, which Cedric believes are worth more.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those apples look lovely, but I can only offer 2 shillings and sixpence. My customers back home are eager for a taste of Fruitville's finest, but they're not willing to pay top dollar.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer and try to negotiate a higher price.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 2 coins

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 3 coins for the apples.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (e)

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket. That's a fair price, considering I'm buying in bulk.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Three and a half, Della, and it's a deal. Not a penny less.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Four and a half coins, Lennon, and I'll take the whole lot.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a market in Fruitville to resell them for a profit.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a market in Fruitville to resell them for a profit.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller who recently had a failed deal with Della Plumstone but successfully sold some apples to Lennon Figtree for 3 coins.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Four coins and not a penny more, Lennon. These peaches will be bruised by nightfall if you don't come down on the price.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know I can't let these beauties go for that price. They're the finest peaches in Fruitville, plump and juicy. Three coins, and we have ourselves a deal.

[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I can only offer you 3 coins for the lot.
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins it is, then. A deal's a deal.
